active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of self-assessment versus third-party C3PAO or DIBCAC assessments for CMMC Level 2 compliance in a mid-sized DIB supplier. Consider costs, reliability, supply chain impacts, and regulatory risks. Support arguments with references to NIST SP 800-171 and Federal Register guidance.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in CMMC (Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification). Use the provided topic hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Supply Chain Risk Management (SCRM) > Governance and Strategy > Legal and Regulatory Compliance > CMMC. Incorporate these elements: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: [REFERENCE FOR INSPIRATION, NOT DIRECT CARDS] - Scaffolding Layers: [INSERT FULL SCAFFOLDING FROM ABOVE, INCLUDING PRIOR KNOWLEDGE] - Research Context: CMMC 2.0 (DoD standard for DIB contractors protecting FCI/CUI). Levels: 1 (self-assess 17 FAR basics), 2 (self/C3PAO assess 110 NIST 800-171), 3 (DIBCAC assess Level 2 + 24 NIST 800-172). Assessments: Self (annual), C3PAO (3-yr cert Level 2), DIBCAC (govt Level 3). Key diffs from 800-171: Adds maturity processes, verification. SSP/POA&M required. Federal Register codifies rules. SCRM integration: Contract flow-down. Generate flashcards following the exact schema: [INSERT FULL FLASHCARD_SCHEMA FROM ABOVE] Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards, each as: {"type": "MCQ", "front": "Question...", "back": "Answer: A. Explanation... Reference: Layer 2, Objective 2. Source: NIST 800-171."} Ensure variety, distractor quality, and alignment to pedagogy. Cover all layers/objectives comprehensively.
